content.body: O hai

<link rel="tag" ... /> - there doesn't seem to be much information in the spec on how the href attribute is handled. Does the last word of the href attribute become the tag name? (as per http://microformats.org/wiki/rel-tag)
I think it is invalid for <link>
or should be
annevk: source is http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#link-type-tag
oh sorry, the URL is the tag
my bad
so in the case of href="http://example.com/example/blue", is the tag "blue" and the page that describes that tag "http://example.com/example/blue"?
the tag is "http://example.com/example/blue"
so a client parsing these tags would probably need to load each URL, grab the <title> of the page (or similar) and display that as the tag name? seems a little vague at the moment
the tag is the link
what you display is up to you
ok, thanks for clarifying
hsivonen, what do you make of this RDFa/Microdata TF?
how do I activate an accesskey on Opera/Linux
alt+shift+<key> doesn't seem to work
Shift+escape, I think
huh
but works
thanks
Can you also download Google web fonts or is it solely for use with their API?
gsnedders hi
my friend have found bug in opera 11.50 http://jsfiddle.net/XV8AU/
in 9.64 - ok
so per HTTP the following is invalid
Content-Type:text/html;
I doubt however anyone follows that
maybe I should raise an issue on that
anyone here which can take a look at a canvas? and tell me what is worn?
wrong?
why is this image so bloated? http://bobc.in/im/drop/cc/tp/bcqo-0
your canvas is 150*300 and then you resized that to style="width:768px;height:1024px" with CSS
only natural that it will look odd
the width/height attributes of <canvas> are meaningful and set the <canvas> drawing area, use them ;)
whereas the CSS properties merely set how big the <canvas> should appear on screen
[15:28] <AryehGregor> It would actually simplify things if I could assume that a selection must be either wholly editable or not.  But it doesn't have
aryehgregor: as a user, i want to be able to copy what i see, i shouldn't be blocked from copying stuff just because every second letter is content editable...
zewt: which mail did gmail say might not have been sent by me? all of my mail is actually sent by timeless.bmo2, but gmail should know and trust that....
tabatkins: if i'm on metered bandwidth your sites which prefetch on mouse hover are incredibly expensive....
annevk: how do you know my canvas is 150*300?
because that's the default if you do not set anything
where do I set them?
using the width and height attributes
I said that earlier
ok i understand, style:width:xx;height:yy; will not do the trick then...
they size the canvas, not the drawing area
oh ok thanks
annevk: i swear nobody every answers a question at #html5 damn mob controlled

It's only like just here
It's so 2007!
Kingdutch, read up: http://blog.whatwg.org/html-is-the-new-html5
selection handling with :before and  :after is... "interesting" in Gecko and Webkit
AryehGregor: are you perhaps spec'ing how selecting text in :before and :after should work?
when the render and DOM tree collapse is no fun
Ah right ok
Hence the <!document html> instead of html5

Or well, more the thing of HTML JS and PHP
Hence why the prototype would still in the end be serving HTML and JS
My biggest problem is a lack of starting point =|
But I guess this is not the right channel to discuss that
Kingdutch, if you write “<!document HTML>”, something is broken.
also, replace HTML. haha. hahahaha. ha.
I meant <!doctype html>
I was close :O
